description: "The Shed" is located in the heart of the historic gold mining village of Tuena with views over Tuena Creek.The shed has been recently renovated as a cosy and comfy two bedroom cabin  that can sleep up to 4 guests. It is complete with a full kitchen (oven, microwave, fridge - freezer), outside ensuite, air conditioning/heating and  TV/DVD, wifi.It is conveniently located behind "Parsons General Store" which offers supplies & alcohol.  The village of Tuena is located 56km north of Crookwell.The spaceTuena is a small, friendly village and ideal for a relaxing get away and is situated halfway between Goulburn and Orange. Abercrombie Caves and river are a short distance away.Other things to noteThere is only the general store nearby that sells alcohol and basic groceries. There are no supermarkets and cafes close byLicense numberPID-STRA-26042
transit: As the Shed is in a small rural village there is no public transport.

description: My place is close to Lake Glenbawn, wineries, horse studs and the beautiful Barrington Tops National Park. You’ll love my place because of the history. Step back in time to 1837.  Segenhoe Inn is said to be the oldest colonial accommodation in Australia.. The Inn suits family groups, business travelers and couples.The spaceThe Inn has 9 bedrooms in total, all individually styled. Guests have access to the guest lounge, formal parlour, guest breakfast room and gardens.Other things to noteThe Inn has an on premises liquor license and the bar can be made available to guests.  The Inn also has its own function room and is perfect for weddings, parties and other functions.License numberExempt
interaction: Meet and greet and guests can choose to interact with the hosts if they wish.
transit: The Inn is within walking distance to the train station and a 2 hour drive to Newcastle Airport.

description: Our secluded, beautifully renovated and private country cottage has been lovingly restored with all the comfort of a modern house. This charming and comfortable space is perfect for couples, families or groups of friends. With no neighbours and magnificent hills views around, this place has everything to make you feel at home, relax and unwind. Fromelles Cottage is a short drive from Scone, known as the Australian Horse Capital: close enough to everything, but far away to enjoy a quiet stay.The spaceThe Fromelles Cottage is serviced with: - Private access with parking for 2 cars (or more) - Key lock box with unique digital access code- Luxury bedding bamboo linen - High comfort pillows- Towels - Comfy and fluffy bathrobe- Organic Shampoo, body wash, body lotion and hand wash - Extra blankets- Hot water bottles to keep you snuggly warm in winter- Dolce Gusto coffee machine and capsules - Instant coffee/Tea - Stocked pantry condiments (olive oil, vinegar, sauces, sugar…)- Tablets for dishwasher and washing powder for laundry- Iron & iron board - Indoor & outdoor drying racks  - Bluetooth speaker, games board, cards, books- 4 burners outdoor barbecue~ Bedroom 1 ~Queen size bed, features a windowsill seat (overlooking the front yard and hills), ideal to sip a coffee. There is a ceiling fan and a clothes rack plus an ample storage space hidden neatly under the bed in 6 large drawers, perfect to store your personal stuffs.  ~ Bedroom 2 ~Queen size bed with an east facing window overlooking the front garden, so you will have morning light to wake you gently. Plenty of storage for your cases and clothes. Ceiling fan & reverse split system. ~ Boudoir ~ The Boudoir leads to the second bedroom, the bathroom and the living room. Equipped with a comfortable single daybed convertible easily in a king size bed.  ~ Living room ~Spacious living-room, with a large comfy sofa convertible to a double bed, a dining table (extendable to fit 8 people), a 50’’ 4K TV with Netflix, YouTube and all the mains entertainment services. And for the winter months, a cosy fireplace with wood provided. Ceiling fan & reverse split system.~ The fully equipped kitchen with modern & brand-new appliances ~- Island bench with 2 stools - Electric oven with 5 burner gas cooker - Dishwasher  - French door fridge with cool water dispenser - Dolce Gusto coffee machine with capsules- Kettle- 4 slices toaster- Microwave- Set of sharp knives- Plenty of pots/pans/cooking utensils- All the tableware you need- Reverse split system & ceiling fan ~ The Outdoor area ~If you want to enjoy the garden, whether a morning cup of coffee or an afternoon glass of wine, there is a lovely outdoor terrace with a fire pit perfect for your winter evenings. Barbecue area and cosy sitting lounge with a coffee table to enjoy the glorious natural landscape. Equipped with shade blinds to enjoy the terrace at any time of day.Guest accessThe entire cottage will be yours for the duration of your stay. Go for walks, explore the valley or gather around the outdoor fire pit to share a drink with your family and friends, come out, watch the stars  and enjoy the space. Guests will be emailed and texted all check in details before their arrival, with their unique digital access code and all instructions for check in, as well as house rules. We also have provided a folder with all the local tourist information. Note: Rooms are made up based on the number of guests at the time of booking.Other things to noteCheck in: 3pmCheck out: 10amIf you need to check in earlier or check out later, please let me know and I will see if I can accommodate this for you, it will just depend on other bookings. About breakfast: Light breakfast supplies are provided including homemade jam, butter, vegemite, honey, milk, sugar,  fruit juice, coffee & tea.  ~ We offer a generous breakfast hamper ~ $35 for 2 persons including bread rolls, bacon & sausages, homegrown eggs, mushrooms and tomatoes.We can also organize a grazing box and some homemade cakes. For more information and to order your hamper, grazing box or cakes please inquire when you make your booking. Your hamper will be ready in the fridge on your arrival.***Note: 24hrs notice is required, and transfer or cash payment can be made before departure.***Pets allowed by prior arrangement.License numberPID-STRA-3972
additional_house_rules:
Please respect the house and treat it like yours. 
Smoking : only outside and cigarette butts in the ashtray, not in the plant pots or on the ground.  
Strictly no party allowed. 
Pets allowed by prior arrangement.
interaction: Feel free to send me a message or text if you need anything. I will be more than happy to help.

description: THE STABLE is Scone's newest and most premium property located in the centre of town.  The 2 bedroom accomodation is housed within a gorgeous historic cottage built in 1831. Sympathetically renovated throughout with brand new kitchen and bathroom in keeping the character of the old building.Relax in the beautiful private courtyard and experience luxury at its best with crisp cotton sheets, pure linens, Bemboka towels and blankets, and fully fitted out kitchen. Offstreet parking, free wifi.The spaceTHE STABLE is located within an historic cottage with a central hallway. The front of the building houses a retail store that is open during business hours.  The accomodation takes up the back half of the building with its own entrance, courtyard and off street parking.  The two bedrooms are interconnecting and the smaller room with the single beds connects to the bathroom.  The kitchen and an additional toilet are located in an attached building accessible via undercover verandah.Guest accessTHE STABLE is located right in the centre of Scone and is within easy walking distance of cafes,  restaurants, pubs and shops.  White Park is at the end of the street and the Scone Race Club and airport only 5 mins drive away on the outskirts of town.License numberPID-STRA-13098
transit: THE STABLE Scone is located right in the centre of town with shops and restaurants only a short walk away. Off street parking available for one vehicle.  Plenty of street parking for other and/or oversized vehicles.

description: Perfectly located with views of the surrounding hills and the main street. Walk to everywhere in town in 10 minutes or less.Quality furnishings with extra little touches to make your stay super comfy! Hillview offers 2 bedrooms, 1 ensuite bathroom, with a clawfoot bathtub and an in bath brass overhead shower. Please note this is the only bathroom at the moment, so be sure that you are comfortable with your Bedroom 2 travelling companions  ;)Two very comfortable living areas for relaxationThe spaceOpposite the Railway Station and only a short walk to local cafes and Woolworths. Hillview Scone is the perfect base for your activities in Scone.Most importantly for Summer, Hillview offers an in ground pool, with covered sitting area. Perfect for the hot Summer weather, and a nice stroll through the backyard to access.Inside - as well as ducted air conditioning and ceiling fans to most rooms, there are two separate living spaces with quality, comfortable furnishings. The main sitting room offers a feather filled, luxurious Duresta sofa and a 65" TV. Netflix has been connected for your entertainment, with other apps such as 9Now, Tenplay, 7Plus, SBS On Demand and ABC iView also available.  There is also a DVD player and some DVD's for those uncomfortable with Smart TV Technology (we know you are out there...)The second living area is furnished with a quality banana leaf lounge suite and bookshelf offering reading material for  your stay, including current magazines. A perfect room for puzzles, reading or just sitting and chatting.The dining room has a lovely timber 8 seater table with very comfortable banana leaf chairs, so if you are planning to see friends or family whilst in town, you have the ideal space to catch up over a meals and a few drinks. Recently we have added a brand new BBQ and outdoor setting so you can enjoy alfresco dining.The modern kitchen is very well equipped, with pots, pans and utensils. A light breakfast is provided, (cereal, bread, milk, selection of teas and coffee and hot chocolate) as are some snacks (bikkies and mug cake ingredients). We also provide some complimentary pantry items such as sauce, salt and pepper, salad dressing, etc. Both bedrooms offer extra comfy queen sized beds, dressed in 1000 thread count Egyptian Cotton linen. The house does have double glazed windows to reduce external noise, but if you are a light sleeper please be aware that we are located on the main street, and you can hear the coal trains running through town (they dont wake us, although we do actually find the sound of the trains romantic, but we understand that not everybody shares our whimsical view).We have literally tried to make Hillview feel like a home away from home where you can relax after a long day, or just curl up with a good book and sink into the feather stuffed sofa.Guest accessThe whole front of the house is available to guests, as are all of the grounds. There is a small section at the back of the house which is not accessible.At present, the house has only 1 bathroom, which is the ensuite to the main bedroom. The shower is located within an old fashioned clawfoot bathtub.Other things to noteScone has the railway running right through town, but our windows are double glazed and the house is relaxing and quiet.The bathtub is an old fashioned claw foot tub, with shower above. If you are unsteady in the shower or need an accessible area, this will not be suitable.The only bathroom is the ensuite off bedroom 1, so guest staying in bedroom 2 will have to access bedroom 1 to use the bathroom.License numberPID-STRA-13556
additional_house_rules:
Please leave the property tidy and in good order (eg. furniture in place, dishes washed and put away).
Do not wear boots in the house, especially if you have been in paddocks or stables during the day. There is a mud room through the back entry of the house which is suitable for outerwear and boots.
interaction: If you have any questions please feel free to email or text me
transit: Parking is plentiful on the property. If you are catching a train to Scone, we are across the road from the station. Hillview is on the main street so close to everything Scone has to offer.

description: 67 acres One of a kindFarmstay with motorcross tracks!The spaceLose yourself in this 67 acre, one of a kind, picturesque farm stays with motorcross tracks!!!With a near new modern country style homestead house boasting a full wrap around verandah with many places to sit & soak up the beautiful views! With 5 bedrooms, up to 12 beds,  sleeps up to 17 guests!!So gather a few families & book your next unique country getaway!!Whether you like to float around in the resort style pool soaking up this peaceful scenery, have a BBQ on the pool deck or get more adventurous and ride the many tracks, jumps, burms & ruts on your motorbike or quad bike..Say hello to our 2 Alpaccas "Garry & Larry" our beautiful inquisitive black Angus cows, "Holly" the horse, “Tarzie" our friendly farm Kelpie, "Puss” the ginger cat, chooks of a few kinds & our 2 pet ducks over at the dam.FRESH FREE RANGE FARM EGGS Be our guest & feel free to collect fresh eggs every morning and add them to your breakfast!CAMPFIRE/COMBUSTION FIRE If you enjoy a good campfire you will love our rather large fire pit out by the pool area, unwind & relax soaking up the beautiful views of the rolling hills and our magnificent sunsets!!! ALL FIREWOOD SUPPLIEDAIR CONDITIONING/FANSThis large open house boasts ducted air conditioning in every room making your stay very comfortable on those warmer days or if just needing a bit of air circulation, all rooms have ceiling fansROOM SETUPS4 out of the 5 bedrooms are large rooms and have beautiful views of the farmRoom 1 = large room - king bed, day bed/single bed, single fold away bed, large ensuite with double showerRoom 2= bunk bed (double on bottom/single on top), king single bedRoom 3= large room - queen bed, single fold away bed, chaise lounge, T.V with foxtel (great lounge room for the kids!)Room 4 = large room - queen bed, futon/double bed, single fold away bedRoom 5= small room - king single bedMAIN BATHROOM is a 3 way bathroom:-Room 1 = double shower, bath and vanityRoom 2 = double vanity Room 3 = toilet KITCHEN is a beautiful large country style kitchen with oven/grill, stove top, dishwasher, microwave, large fridge/freezer with filtered water & ice, small coffee machine, kettle, toaster, Nutri Bullet, air fryer and fully equipped with all your kitchen needs!LAUNDRY is a large room with a large washing machine, a dryer, ironing board & fridge/freezerPOOLYARD/ DECK There is a large flat plate gas BBQ, timber dining table that seats 8-12, Outdoor lounge with coffee table & side tables that seats 5-6 & a double swing chair for relaxing! We also have 6 sun lounges So plenty of seating for everyone!You won’t be sorry you made this escape to the country! You will feel well rejuvenated when you leave and will want to re-book your next unique farm stay getaway!!!CHECK IN TIME: (strictly) from 4:00pmCHECK OUT TIME: 3:00pm on weekends, (strictly) 10:00am during school holidaysGuest accessYou have the entire farm to yourself apart from the 3 sheds & 2 shipping containers - they are not for guest use.But if you see our two sons Luke & Zac working on their motorbikes in the small shed, feel free to ask them any questions you may have, they would be happy to help, if they can’t answer your question please call/message us any time.If you have any minor motorbike repairs/maintenance, Luke is your man! He will do his best to help you out to get you back on the tracks!Other things to noteRULES OF ENTRYAs motorbike/quad bike riding is a dangerous sport we recommend having your own insurances for if any accidents occur so you can rest assured you will be covered.We have a Liability Waiver Agreement that needs to be completed & signed prior to your arrival which will be emailed to you & will need to be signed by all guests in your group booking & emailed back prior to arrival.We have rules that need to be adhered to on our farm so if you would like to see our Liability Waiver/Rules please let us knowLicense numberPID-STRA-6726
additional_house_rules:
DAMAGES:
Any damages are to be paid for by guests.

NO PARTIES:
No bucks parties/no large groups of young men without adult supervision/no parties of any kind, this is a family orientated farm, for any other large gatherings please ask

RUBBISH:
Please use bins provided for general waste and cans/bottles
once general waste bins are full, please empty into skip bin
once cans/bottles bins are full, please empty into designated wiz bins up side of large shed

BRINGING MOTORBIKES/QUAD BIKES/TRIKES
If intending to ride motorbike/quad bike/trike etc you must sign our Liability Waiver Agreement & Rules/Safety Warning before u arrive. Please advise so the form can be emailed to you and returned prior to arrival. 

We have Liability Insurance but we still recommend you have your own insurances for any accidents that may occur.  
Helmet must be worn at all times and we strongly recommend protective gear to be worn also.

There are 5 tracks for riders of any level/age, please ride to your ability 

ALCOHOL - NO DRIVING:
No drinking & riding/driving
No riding after dark
The use of the dams are to cease after dark.


NO GUEST ACCESS:
All 3 sheds are private & shipping containers are out of bounds
Please respect caretakers that live on property in large shed/granny flat near house and keep nose to a minimum after 10pm.
interaction: Our two eldest sons live on the property in the large shed/granny flat. They will be happy to answer any questions especially with the motorcross tracks &/ or help with any small motorbike repairs. MOTORBIKESThe boys ride the motorcross tracks/jumps so if you don’t mind the noise of a few bikes they are great riders and a must watch!!!If you’re bringing your own bikes they will love to ride with you and Luke would love to interact with you about his man-made tracks!!If you would prefer no noise from bikes, please let us know in advance & our boys won’t ride during your stay. (Bearing in mind when they are out on the property the noise is quite muffled)We come & go so we could be there staying with our boys in the shed or camping down by the dam with family/friends in our caravan so feel free to have a chat and ask any questions or if we aren’t there please don’t hesitate to call/text us any time
transit: Here in Castle Rock you can book a ride share if you don’t want to drive. There are several vineyards only 15mins away, Two Rivers Wines-Denman, Small Forest Wines-Denman , Horseshoe Vineyard-Martindale, Pukara Olive Oil Estate-Muswellbrook & the closest towns - Muswellbrook is also only 15mins away for all your essentials & as is Denman a quaint little country town with great pubs & cafes.

description: This completely renovated gorgeous period home boasts 3 generous bedrooms and a separate lounge room appointed with leather couches and vintage chandelier.  A collection of high-end magazines and an eclectic mix of CDs & DVDs makes sure there is something for everyone.A short 2 minute walk to Scone's boutiques, restaurants and Coles supermarket is located at end of the street.  RSL & Golf Club are literally steps away.Enjoy fishing, wineries, world class horse studs and art galleries.The spaceThe Cedars is your passport to luxury, relaxation and stylish country ambience.  Nothing has been spared.  This gorgeous country property exudes charm with all the modern conveniences to make your stay unforgettable....whether it is for business or purely for pleasure.Our Brides are well catered for with the magical "Bride Box" for those last moment touches on your Special Day.Your accommodation includes:- Complimentary wireless internet- Ducted reverse cycle air conditioning throughout- Elegant black & white designer kitchen, fully equipped with Caesarstone bench tops, SMEG dishwasher, china, glassware, utensils & cookware- Luxurious bathroom and dreamy white fluffy bathrobes, hairdryer, rain-shower head, underfloor heating, separate bath and walk in shower. Double vanity, double mirrors complete this heavenly space- Spacious family room featuring KING furniture designer sofa which converts to a extremely comfortable bed if required- 42 inch Digital TV with Austar 40+ channel selection- Iron, ironing board, washing machine and dryer- Massive back outdoor Entertaining deck perfect for drinks or dining with BBQ- PortacotLicense numberPID-STRA-14815
interaction: We are available at all times during your stay.

name: Country House Retreat

description: Situated within a stunning 300 Acre farm, this beautifully furnished, spacious home has multiple open-plan living areas. With several open fireplaces and an array of outdoor living areas this luxurious dwelling is versatile and accommodating no matter the season.The spaceThe high ceilings and bright open spaces of this single story home provides an array of living areas to entertain or retreat to. Every one of the five bedrooms within the main house boasts spectacular views of the hunter valley landscapes and is luxuriously furnished with high quality linen. The panoramic vista of the surrounding hills is the perfect back drop for Al Fresco dining on the extensive veranda which surrounds the house; perfect for winter and summer, as it is complete with an outdoor fireplace. Alternatively, enjoy your evening relaxing by one of the houses two indoor open fire places.The house also offers a swimming pool with cabana, which is ideal for unwinding on a warm day. As an equestrian property we are able to offer guests the chance to stay with their OWN horses. Both stables and paddocks are available for lease during your stay and with the ample country to explore, you wont be lost for places to ride.No matter the season, the charm and tranquil surroundings of this beautifully appointed home will ensure you have a wonderful stay.Guest accessThe entire house, with exception to the owners wing.There is a separate self-contained two bedroom apartment which is private from the main house. Depending on availability at the time of booking this may also be available to hire. It consists of a double and twin bedroom, with its own bathroom, kitchen & living area.Other things to noteAs an equestrian property we are able to offer guests the chance to stay with their OWN horses. Both stables and paddocks are available for lease during your stay and with the ample country to explore, you wont be lost for places to ride.License numberPID-STRA-18468
interaction: A benefit to having the property owners on-site; we will be here 24/7 to assist with any queries and the possibility of catering via prior arrangement.

description: Enjoy the elegance of a by gone era while staying at this beautifully decorated period home. Originally built for the first Mayor of Scone, The Devonshire has been lovingly restored with timber floors, high decorative ceilings & modern details for a luxury yet charming feel. Retreat to the deck of the quirky, fabulous converted vintage horse float bar and gaze at the twinkling constellations under the pink sky of Scone. Located in the best tree lined street in Scone & only a 5 min walk to town.The spaceThe Devonshire is a gorgeous 4 bedroom home that has a beautiful flow to the outside entertaining and garden area via a superb architecturally designed extension.Perched up the back is a restored vintage horse float that has been converted to a bar and looks down to the back of the entertaining area.The Devonshire is filled with newly landscaped gardens including privacy hedges, olive trees, and a cacti garden.  The home is full of divine period features, fabulous lighting and filled with art, books and a beautiful red piano and Keith Urban guitar, if you are feeling musical?If you love to cook, you will enjoy the modern contemporary kitchen with a lovely modern dining area with built in banquette seating.  There is a lovely summer porch out front, French doors, magnificent ceiling fans and of course The Devonshire is fully air-conditioned. For those winter days and nights, enjoy the light filled sunroom with the combustion wood heater overlooking the garden and outdoor entertaining area.The Devonshire is located in the best street in Scone, full of gum trees and jacarandas and only a 5 minute walk to town.  Beautifully furnished, The Devonshire has everything you need to have an amazing luxury stay in Scone.Guest accessThere is ample parking out the front to the Devonshire and also the side street.  The house is located 5 minutes the centre of town where you will find a Woolworths, Coles, pharmacy, cafes and lots of fantastic country pubs..License numberPID-stra-30388
additional_house_rules:
The person making this booking accepts these rules and all the information in the listing on behalf of every person staying (guest) as part of this booking and is responsible for advising every other guest of the same.

There is a strictly no-party policy.  

The guest who made the booking using their profile, must be at the property for the duration of the stay.  

Access to the property, including all areas, external and internal is provided only to the number of people booked in the reservation. 

No additional persons are provided permission to stay or visit.  

No pets are allowed. We respectfully request that you don't ask us to make an exception to this rule.  

There is a no-smoking policy on the property. If you wish to smoke, please go off the property.   

Please respect our neighbours and keep noise to a minimum before 8am and after 10pm.
transit: There is ample on street parking in front the The Devonshire and also on the side street. The town centre of Scone is a 5 minute walk where you will find Woolworths, Coles, pharmacies, cafes and some great country pubs.

description: This fully equipped 1BR with private courtyard is walking distance to everything, Coles is adjacent, and the fabulous new restaurant The Cottage is right across the street. It's a little dated, but very comfortable. Suits short or long stays.The spaceThis air conditioned unit is the Managers Residence at Portman House serviced apartments, right in the centre of Scone.  It has only just been furnished and equipped for Airbnb (May 2016) so most things are brand new.The Managers Residence will accommodate a maximum of four guests; two is more ideal for a longer stay.  The bedroom consists a queen size bed, a double bunk and a wardrobe.  The living areas are cosy and inviting, and there's Foxtel included in the rate. The dining table extends if extra space is needed.  There's a private outdoor courtyard.  The kitchen is relatively modern, and although the bathroom and toilet are dated, they are functional.  Check out the pictures and judge for yourself.  There's a good size fridge, stove with oven, microwave, washing machine and dryer.Parking is not available on site, but there is plenty of street parking available close by.  WIFI is unavailable at this stage sorry.Guest accessYou have the whole unit to yourself for your stay.  The Portman House office and storeroom are close by and are accessed from time to time during the day, but the cleaners or manager will not interrupt you.License numberExempt
additional_house_rules: Guests are expected to treat the property respectfully.  No parties are allowed and please keep noise to a minimum.  Smoking is not permitted inside the unit.
interaction: If you have any questions during your stay you are very welcome to contact the Portman House manager who will be happy to help with your enquiry.
transit: You will be walking distance from everything in town, Coles is directly adjacent, there are lots of great cafes close by, such as Kerv.  For a memorable dining experience you must visit The Cottage, directly opposite, it’s absolutely wonderful.  Reservations are essential on weekends.You will be a five minute walk from Scone Station, which is the best way to get to Scone.  The train trip takes about as long as the drive to Scone, about four hours from Sydney’s Central Station.  The big difference is you can relax, have a nap, make use of the dining car, work on your laptop, read, or look out the window and take in the spectacular vistas, especially going down through Brooklyn.If you must drive from Sydney it’s pretty easy thanks to the new Hunter Expressway.  About 3 hours once you get to Hornsby.  There’s plenty of street parking close by.
